summary: This is the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust Agreement, dated November 18, 2014, establishing a trust with Epstein as Grantor and three initial Trustees. The document outlines the administration of the trust during Epstein's life and after his death, including specific bequests totaling tens of millions of dollars to numerous individuals, forgiveness of loans, and the transfer of major properties into separate trusts for a primary beneficiary.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator and primary beneficiary of the trust during his lifetime; reserves extensive powers to amend, revoke, and withdraw assets.

connections.description: Indyke is appointed as a Trustee of Epstein's trust and is also a beneficiary, indicating a close professional and financial relationship.
Staley is appointed as a Trustee of Epstein's trust.
Mitchell is appointed as a Trustee of Epstein's trust.
Brunel is named as a $5 million beneficiary and has personal loans from Epstein forgiven.
Shuliak is named as a $10 million beneficiary and has personal loans forgiven.
Andersson Dubin is named as the successor trustee and the primary residuary beneficiary, indicating a position of significant trust.
Both are named as beneficiaries and individuals with forgiven loans in the same trust document.

events.title: Execution of Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signs the trust agreement establishing 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust,' naming three initial Trustees and outlining the distribution of his assets during his life and after his death.

State of New York, County of New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein established a complex trust in November 2014, just over four years before his death, granting himself extensive lifetime control while planning for posthumous asset distribution.
The trust document lists over 20 specific beneficiaries for cash bequests totaling at least $37,243,000, with the largest single bequest of $10 million to Karyna Shuliak.
Epstein forgave loans made to at least 17 individuals and entities, including associates Jean Luc Brunel, Mark Epstein, and several staff members.

Major properties (Paris apartment, NY townhouse, Little St. James Island, Zorro Ranch, Palm Beach home) were to be placed into separate 'residence trusts' for a primary female beneficiary, with millions allocated for their operating expenses.
Eva Andersson Dubin is named as the successor trustee and the primary residuary beneficiary, positioning her as a central figure in the trust's administration after Epstein's death.
